questionInfo: How are computer models tested in order to determine whether or not they are valid?
correctAnswer: Computer models are tested by examining the model structure, i.e., the algorithms and relationship, to see how closely it corresponds to the actual system definition.
reason: Computer models are tested by examining the model structure, i.e., the algorithms and relationship, to see how closely it corresponds to the actual system definition. If the model is an accurate representation of the actual system, it is considered to be valid. The person can use different validating techniques like resubstitution, hold-out, LOOCV, random subsampling, bootstrapping.

questionInfo: Which among the following correctly defines the term cookie?
correctAnswer: It is a message given to a web browser by a web server
options: It is a message given to a web browser by a web server
It is a password stored by web server
It is virus that corrupts other web file
It is intentionally created deceptive message that collects user’s personal information
reason: The browser stores the message (i.e. cookie) in a text file.

correctAnswer: A file is a named location which stores data or information permanently.
reason: A file is a named location which stores data or information permanently. A file is always stored inside a storage device using file name (e.g. STUDENT.MARKS). A file name normally has primary and secondary name separated by a “.”(DOT).
